newsitem.title: INDIA: India panel on economic crimes to meet on July 22.
newsitem.headline: India panel on economic crimes to meet on July 22.

text.p: India's Economic Intelligence Council (EIC), which has been reonstituted under Finance Minister P.Chidambaram, will hold its first meeting on July 22, the government said on Thursday.

The 18-member council comprising senior government officials was reconstituted on Wednesday, and the government said its task would be evolve a coordinated strategy to control black money and economic crimes.

The council would discuss measures to coordinate the work of law enforcement agencies, monitor important cases involving coordination, and keep a watch on economic crimes to suggest effective measures to deal with them, the statement said.
